newsitem.title: USA: Bausch & Lomb and Pfizer settle Visine lawsuit.
newsitem.headline: Bausch & Lomb and Pfizer settle Visine lawsuit.

text.p: Bausch & Lomb said Monday it settled a lawsuit against its competitor Pfizer Inc. after the pharmaceutical company agreed to take television advertisements for its Visine eye care product off the air.
Separately, Pfizer defended the accuracy of the advertisements, saying they contained accurate information.
Bausch & Lomb said it filed a lawsuit against Pfizer on June 4 alleging "false and misleading advertising" of Visine as the best over-the-counter comprehensive allergy relief agent for the eye.
Under the settlement, New York-based Pfizer admitted no wrongdoing but agreed not to air the television commercial again, Bausch & Lomb said.
Bausch & Lomb, based in Rochester, N.Y., added that no financial payment was involved.

Pfizer settled the lawsuit "solely to avoid the costs and inconvenience of potentially lengthy litigation," Pfizer spokesman Bob Fauteux said. He added that the commercial was taken off the air as originally scheduled, in mid-June.
Bausch & Lomb's stock fell 94 cents to $46.94, while Pfizer slid $1.75 to $62 on the New York Stock Exchange in late trading.
